intro: Kaulinia insignis, commonly known as the mountain kaulinia, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Kaulinia insignis is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
